descriptions.description: More maintainer time increases the rate at which issues can be resolved.
The issue resolution rate increases the stock of closed issues.
Greater explicit knowledge enables more effective knowledge transfer through documentation.
Better documentation lowers the barrier to entry, increasing the joining rate.
Clear documentation helps contributors learn faster, accelerating their skill-up.
More feedback from the community can lead to the identification of new issues.
A high number of open issues generates more user feedback and discussion.
A higher issue creation rate directly increases the stock of open issues.
A higher issue resolution rate decreases the stock of open issues.
More open issues often inspire contributors to submit pull requests to fix them.
A higher review rate decreases the stock of new pull requests by processing them.
A higher new PR rate increases the stock of new pull requests.
New pull requests move into the 'under review' stock once work begins on them.
Providing PR feedback is a key activity that occurs on pull requests under review.
A higher rejection rate decreases the stock of pull requests under review.
Merging or committing a PR removes it from the 'under review' stock.
The code from reviewed and merged pull requests contributes to the project's source code.
More source code provides more surface area for users to discover and report issues.
More core developers reduce the average delay for pull request reviews.
Shorter review delays enable faster and more timely feedback on pull requests.
As new contributors skill up, they graduate out of the 'new contributors' stock.
A higher joining rate increases the stock of new contributors.
Receiving constructive PR feedback helps retain new contributors.
The promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move up.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors.
Positive PR feedback reinforces an experienced contributor's commitment and skills.
Consistently high-quality contributions and feedback can lead to promotion to core developer.
The promotion rate directly increases the stock of core developers.
Developer turnover decreases the stock of core developers when they leave the project.
A larger stock of implicit knowledge provides more material for mentorship.
More core developers increase the capacity for mentorship and implicit knowledge transfer.
Effective mentorship accelerates the skill-up of contributors.
Mentorship prepares contributors for greater responsibility, increasing the promotion rate.
When developers leave, their unique, tacit knowledge is lost.
The loss of knowledge through turnover depletes the project's implicit knowledge stock.
Converting explicit knowledge to implicit understanding enriches the project's implicit knowledge.
The knowledge conversion rate depletes implicit knowledge as it is formalized into explicit forms.
The knowledge conversion rate increases explicit knowledge by documenting tacit understanding.
Converting knowledge from explicit to implicit form utilizes and transforms that explicit knowledge.
A more comprehensive searchable knowledge base directly represents more explicit knowledge.
Feedback from PR reviews often contains insights that are added to the knowledge base.
Closed issues, especially their resolutions, become valuable entries in the knowledge base.
Community engagement through forums and chats generates content for the knowledge base.
Discussions often resolve problems and create documentation for the knowledge base.
The adoption rate increases the user base as new users start using the software.
User churn decreases the user base as users stop using the software.
A larger user base contributes to the project's visibility and reputation.
Reputation building through success and advocacy increases the project's reputation stock.
Reputation decline, from bugs or poor support, decreases the project's reputation.
High software quality and rich features directly enhance the project's reputation.
A healthy, vibrant community signals project stability and increases its reputation.
A large user base demonstrates popularity and validation, boosting reputation.
Trust building through positive interactions strengthens the overall health of the community.
Culture erosion from conflict or toxicity damages the health of the community.
A good project reputation attracts more potential contributors, influencing the joining rate.
Good documentation makes the project more accessible, increasing the joining rate.
A strong project reputation attracts more contributors, increasing the joining rate.
